title: Mansheej Paul
text:
Hi! I’m a Ph.D. student at Stanford University investigating the principles and mechanisms that underlie learning in neural networks. My research focuses on understanding how the data distribution and optimization choices drive the encoding of information and emergence of computational abilities. My goal is to use these insights to design interventions in training that can make models more efficient, reliable, and controllable.
I am currently advised by Surya Ganguli and am a part-time intern at FAIR. Previously, I was at the RegLab at Stanford University where I worked with partners at the Internal Revenue Service and Deparment of Labor on using machine learning to optimally allocate scarse government resources.
I have also volunteered for SF New Deal where I helped research and draft their economic impact report. Whenever I get the chance, I like to go out social dancing and am part of Cardinal West Coast Swing and the Stanford Tango Club.
